Package it.polimi.ingsw.common.models

Class Action

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.common.models.Action
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Action
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class defines actions that a player can do during a game.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Action.Builder  
      static class  Action.Type
      Each type of this enum represents a specific action that a player can do in the game

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addBasicTarget​(java.util.UUID basicTarget)
      add the identifier of a player you want to fire with basic or alternative fire mode
      void addFirstAdditionalTarget​(java.util.UUID firstAdditionalTarget)
      add the identifier of a player you want to fire with first additional fire mode
      void addPowerUpPayment​(@NotNull PowerUp powerUp)
      the @powerUp will be used as alternative payment for this action
      void addSecondAdditionalTarget​(java.util.UUID secondAdditionalTarget)
      add the identifier of a player you want to fire with second additional fire mode
      @NotNull Action.Type getActionType()  
      boolean getAlternativeFire()
      when a player wants to fire, depending on the using weapon, maybe he has to choose which effect wants to use
      @Nullable java.util.List<java.util.UUID> getBasicTarget()
      if action is FIRE, gets the targets of the basic effect
      @Nullable java.awt.Point getBasicTargetPoint()
      if action is FIRE, gets a point, which meaning depends on the specific weapon
      AmmoCard.Color getColor()
      this field is used when a power up is used and represents its color
      @Nullable java.awt.Point getDestination()
      the meaning of the point depends on action type: - MOVE: the destination of the player; - GRAB_AMMOCARD: the point where a player wants to grab the tile; - GRAB_WEAPON: the point where a player wants to grab a weapon; - USE_POWER_UP: depends on type of using power up; - FIRE: if player can move before shooting, this point represents the position that he wants to reach before shooting
      @Nullable Weapon getDiscardedWeapon()
      this field is needed when a player wants to grab a weapon, but he already has got 3 weapons; this weapon will be drop where @getWeapon() it will be grabbed
      @Nullable java.util.List<java.util.UUID> getFirstAdditionalTarget()
      if action is FIRE, gets the targets of the first additional effect
      @Nullable java.awt.Point getFirstAdditionalTargetPoint()
      if action is FIRE, gets a point, which meaning depends on the specific weapon
      @NotNull java.util.UUID getGameUuid()  
      int getOptions()
      indicates modes of fire (depends on the specific weapon): 0 -> only basic effect; 1 -> basic effect + first additional effect 2 -> basic effect + second additional effect 3 -> basic effect + first + second additional effect
      @Nullable java.util.List<PowerUp> getPowerUpPayment()
      when a player has to pay for his action he can use some of his power ups to pay
      PowerUp.Type getPowerUpType()
      this field is used for two types of action: - USE_POWER_UP: the type of the using power up; - REBORN: the type of the power up used to spawn.
      @Nullable java.util.List<java.util.UUID> getSecondAdditionalTarget()
      if action is FIRE, gets the targets of the second additional effect
      @Nullable java.awt.Point getSecondAdditionalTargetPoint()
      if action is FIRE, gets a point, which meaning depends on the specific weapon
      @Nullable java.util.UUID getTarget()
      if action is USE_POWER_UP..
      @Nullable Weapon getWeapon()
      an action can contain a weapon, its meaning depends on action type: -GRAB WEAPON: it's the weapon a player wants to grab; -FIRE: it's the weapon a player wants to use to fire -RELOAD: it's the weapon a player wants to reload
      void setAlternativeFire​(boolean alternativeFire)
      set true if you are building a FIRE action and you want to use alternative fire mode, false otherwise
      void setBasicTargetPoint​(@Nullable java.awt.Point basicTargetPoint)
      set a point which meaning depends on basic or alternative fire mode of a weapon you want to use to fire
      void setDestination​(@Nullable java.awt.Point destination)
      set coordinates of a point of the game board the meaning of the point depends on action type: - MOVE: the destination of the player; - GRAB_AMMOCARD: the point where a player wants to grab the tile; - GRAB_WEAPON: the point where a player wants to grab a weapon; - USE_POWER_UP: depends on type of using power up; - FIRE: if player can move before shooting, this point represents the position that he wants to reach before shooting
      void setFirstAdditionalTargetPoint​(@Nullable java.awt.Point firstAdditionalTargetPoint)
      set a point which meaning depends on first additional fire mode of a weapon you want to use to fire
      void setOptions​(int options)
      set modes of fire (depends on the specific weapon): 0 -> only basic effect; 1 -> basic effect + first additional effect 2 -> basic effect + second additional effect 3 -> basic effect + first + second additional effect

    • Method Detail

      • getActionType

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Action.Type getActionType()
        Returns:
        the type of action that a player is trying to make

      • getGameUuid

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.util.UUID getGameUuid()
        Returns:
        the identifier of the game which this action is referred to

      • getWeapon

        @Nullable
public @Nullable Weapon getWeapon()
        an action can contain a weapon, its meaning depends on action type: -GRAB WEAPON: it's the weapon a player wants to grab; -FIRE: it's the weapon a player wants to use to fire -RELOAD: it's the weapon a player wants to reload
        Returns:
        the weapon

      • getDiscardedWeapon

        @Nullable
public @Nullable Weapon getDiscardedWeapon()
        this field is needed when a player wants to grab a weapon, but he already has got 3 weapons; this weapon will be drop where @getWeapon() it will be grabbed
        Returns:
        the weapon

      • getDestination

        @Nullable
public @Nullable java.awt.Point getDestination()
        the meaning of the point depends on action type: - MOVE: the destination of the player; - GRAB_AMMOCARD: the point where a player wants to grab the tile; - GRAB_WEAPON: the point where a player wants to grab a weapon; - USE_POWER_UP: depends on type of using power up; - FIRE: if player can move before shooting, this point represents the position that he wants to reach before shooting
        Returns:
        a point of the board

      • getPowerUpType

        @Nullable
public PowerUp.Type getPowerUpType()
        this field is used for two types of action: - USE_POWER_UP: the type of the using power up; - REBORN: the type of the power up used to spawn.
        Returns:
        the type of the using power up

      • getColor

        @Nullable
public AmmoCard.Color getColor()

        Returns:
        the color of the power up

      • getPowerUpPayment

        @Nullable
public @Nullable java.util.List<PowerUp> getPowerUpPayment()
        when a player has to pay for his action he can use some of his power ups to pay
        Returns:
        the power ups the player wants to use to pay

      • getAlternativeFire

        public boolean getAlternativeFire()
        when a player wants to fire, depending on the using weapon, maybe he has to choose which effect wants to use
        Returns:
        true if he wants to use the alternative effect of the weapon, false otherwise

      • getOptions

        public int getOptions()
        indicates modes of fire (depends on the specific weapon): 0 -> only basic effect; 1 -> basic effect + first additional effect 2 -> basic effect + second additional effect 3 -> basic effect + first + second additional effect
        Returns:
        modes of fire

      • setAlternativeFire

        public void setAlternativeFire​(boolean alternativeFire)

        Parameters:

      • setOptions

        public void setOptions​(int options)

        Parameters:
        options - a number

        Parameters:
        destination - coordinates of a point in board game
